measured_by: neutral face bias scores from the face-judgment task (trustworthy vs. not-trustworthy classifications)
justification: “Trustworthy judgments of the most ambiguous face type (neutral non-emotional faces) were used as a marker of individual differences in trust biases… Bias scores were calculated for each participant… Neutral faces served as the dependent variable in analyses.”

measured_by: representational similarity analysis (RSA) applied to multi-voxel fMRI patterns
justification: “Neural profile similarity in response to faces at the extremes of the trustworthy gradient were evaluated using RSA… Neural similarity in the amygdala for trustworthy versus untrustworthy faces was significantly related to bias scores for neutral faces.”
construct: amygdala representational similarity of trustworthy vs. untrustworthy faces

measured_by: beta-series correlation connectivity analysis on fMRI data
justification: “Functional connectivity between the amygdala and insula was examined using a beta-series approach… The connectivity map for untrustworthy faces was subtracted from that of trustworthy faces… Greater connectivity dissimilarity…was associated with a greater trust bias.”
construct: amygdala–insula functional connectivity dissimilarity between trustworthy and untrustworthy faces
